summary: This document is a travel authorization request and itinerary for two Assistant United States Attorneys (AUSAs) from the Southern District of New York to travel to London, England, from October 12-17, 2020. The purpose is to interview a potential witness in the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his associates, specifically regarding violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423 (transportation of minors for illicit sexual activity). The witness is a former employee or associate of a target and is considered critical to corroborating victim testimony.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signs the memorandum requesting approval for foreign travel for AUSAs to interview a witness in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation centers on criminal conduct undertaken by him and his associates, specifically the transportation of minors for illicit sexual activity.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a subject of the investigation, believed to be a citizen of the US, UK, and France.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: A citizen and resident of the United Kingdom, former employee or associate of a target, identified as a potentially valuable witness to be interviewed in London.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same investigation into the transportation of minors for illicit sexual activity.
Jane Doe is described as a former employee or associate of a target of the investigation, with Ghislaine Maxwell being a named target.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is authorizing and submitting the travel request for the unnamed AUSAs.

events.title: Prosecutor Travel to London for Witness Interview
events.description: Two AUSAs from the SDNY travel to London, England, to interview a key witness (Jane Doe) in the Epstein investigation over multiple days.

events.title: HTSOS Training Completion
events.description: The traveling AUSAs completed High Threat Security Overseas Seminar training, a requirement for their travel to London.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: In October 2020, SDNY prosecutors traveled to London to interview a UK-based witness (Jane Doe) described as a former employee/associate of a target (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation.
The investigation focused on possible violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423, involving the transportation of minors for illicit sexual activity within the United States.
The witness was considered critical to corroborating victim testimony and providing information necessary to meet elements of the crimes being investigated.
The witness refused to be interviewed by video due to the sensitivity of the subject matter, insisting on an in-person meeting in the UK.

The travel authorization confirms the ongoing and active nature of the Epstein investigation by the SDNY in late 2020, specifically targeting associates for their roles in the alleged sex trafficking scheme.
